title: As a user I want to see an error if I am entering a new grandfathered player profile that matches another profile (4 of 6)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
AND user is  entering a new grandfathered player profile that matches another profile (4 of 6)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Next" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND For grandfathered players, this is a 4 of 6 check instead of 4 of 7 because we do not allow them to enter Player IDs for grandfathered players as a criteria. 
AND If a match is found, the user gets a hard error. See Messages #7
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is run on "Save" when the profile is being edited. 

*Because there are no visibility rules around grandfathered players - this works the same for all users*

Business Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches-_grandfathered

Messages #7: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to see an error if I am entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
AND user is entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Next" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate profile check according to the provided rules (National ID Only for this story). 
AND If a National ID is entered, the system should check to see if any other International Amateur profile already exists with the same National ID and Country.  
AND If another international amateur profile is found with the same National ID and National ID country, the user gets a hard error. See Messages #7
AND If no match is found, the user is able to proceed with profile creation. 

*Because there are no visibility rules around grandfathered players - this works the same for all users*

Business Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches-_grandfathered

Messages #7: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to save a new Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with edit Grandfathered profile permissions
AND User has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Grandfathered profile in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available as well as a "Cancel" button.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
OR If the user clicks "Save", then the system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and throws a blue successful save notification.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches an Unregistered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration Status of "Unregistered", then the user gets a warning. See Messages #5.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND The "Register MLSB Entered" button should only be enabled if the information that matches the MLSB Unregistered Profile is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register MLSB Entered" should navigate the user to the Unregistered MLSB entered profile. (Actual registration covered in a separate story). 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I have already entered or added to my Club registration List
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration Status of "Unregistered", then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. This is the default selection. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND Any matches to the entered information that belong to a profile that the Club registered or are already on the Club's Registration List are displayed as matches, but the radio buttons are greyed out or simply not displayed.  
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a registration profile I have not yet added to my Club registration List
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration profile that the user has not already Registered or added to their Club Reg List then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND The "Add to Club Reg List" button should only be enabled if the information that matches the existing Registration Profile is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Add to Club Reg List" should navigate the user to the existing Registration profile. (Actual addition to the Club Reg List is covered in a separate story). 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a Club user I do NOT want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I do not have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN club user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND Club users will only see a match per stories if they have permission to view the matching profile as a match. 
AND Club users are able to see a profile as a match under the following conditions: 
  - The player has been selected for L2 Registration by the BOC.
  - The player has been entered by the viewing Org.
  - The player has been added to the viewing Org's Club Reg List. 
  - The player has passed their Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The player has been identified as a Group 1 or Group 2 player from their MLSB Reports. (flag on profile)
  - The player has been explicitly been made public by the BOC by a flag on their profile. 
BUT If none of the above conditions have been met - then the player may appear as a match only under the following conditions: 
        - The player has been registered and their First Review has been set to "Verified" or "Pre-Verified". 
        - The player is Unregistered and does not have a Scouting Status of "International Suspect".

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Visibility Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a user I want to create a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Create New" on International dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN System will load Create New Player form.
AND user will see the "Register" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered. 
AND The National ID fields are conditionally required based on the selection of "Birth Country", and this should be reflected via the red asterisks displayed on the UI. 
AND Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB on or after 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new registration profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
AND There are a lot of conditionally displayed fields on these profiles, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration Reviews and Means of Contact sections are not visible on create. 
AND Any action buttons and calculated fields (Eligible to Sign date/Meets Age Requirements) are handled in follow up stories.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a user I want to save a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND User is in the create new player form
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Save" on the new Registration profile form
custom_expected:
THEN The system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and a blue successful save notification is thrown. 
AND Fields are conditionally required, especially upload labels, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration status should be set to "Pending BOC Review" on save.
OR If the user Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 


Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to see all previous Player IDs of an international amateur on their player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logs in with international amateur player profile permission
AND a international amateur player profile has been merged(Including the ones in ebis 2.0)
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing the international amateur player profile in ebis 2.5
custom_expected:
THEN "Player ID" field in the header of the profile should display all of the prior player IDs for the player
AND The previous ids will be listed after the current ID in grey #bbbbbb
AND Hovering over one of the previous ids should reveal a tooltip that says "Previous ID"
AND This data is ONLY visible to the BOC. No clubs can see this regardless of status of the player. 
AND This is only for international amateurs (registration profiles).

title: As a BOC user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches another profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Create permissions for Registration Profile 
AND user navigates to International tab 
AND user is entering info that matches existing profile in the create new Registration Profile form
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Register" on the Create New will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules
custom_expected:
THEN If a match is found to another international player profile, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or 5. This should work the same as for Club users, except there are no visibility restrictions for the BOC, so they will see matches to any matching profile in the system. 
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. This is the default selection. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND Any matches to the entered information that belong to a profile that the Club registered or are already on the Club's Registration List are displayed as matches, but the radio buttons are greyed out or simply not displayed. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Unregistered, there should be a "Register MLSB Entered" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. Clicking the button should navigate the user to the Unregistered profile. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Registered, but not yet on the BOC's Club Registration list, there should be an "Add to Club Reg List" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. 
AND Clicking the button should navigate the user to the relevant profile. 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to see National ID required if a player's Birth Country requires it
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
custom_steps: WHEN entering a player info on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN The system will prepopulated the National ID country based on the country selected for the Country of Residence (just like Birth Country). 
AND The "National ID Type" field is ONLY displayed if there is more than one type available (currently only true for US and its territories). 
AND If the National ID has a validation check, the required format is displayed as help text in the National ID field. 
AND If the National ID has a validation check and a national ID is entered, hitting "Next" or "Register" from the Create New will verify that the National ID entered matches the required format. 
AND If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country a red * will be visible.
AND If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country, and no National ID value is entered, then hitting "Register" or "Next" will trigger a required field error. 
AND The National ID fields will prepopulate on the profile whatever was entered on the Create New. 
AND The same validation and required field checks run on the Create New will also be run anytime the profile is Saved. 
AND If there is no National ID required and one is NOT entered, then in view mode - no National ID fields will display. (even though National ID country is selected).
AND If a national ID has been entered, it displays in view mode like it does now for Pro Player Profiles, with the Country subheading and using the "Display" value from the Country Listing document. (see comment for example)
* This story is also to serve as a general cleanup of how the Country fields work. What is contained in the provided documentation is 100% correct for National ID Information and for the third sub-level Sector information. Any other discrepancies, please discuss with me (Camille) prior to implementing changes. The intent is that at the end of this the documentation and system are 100% in sync!


Acceptance Criteria: 
*Note that some of the validation checks here ARE different from what is in the DB so this will need to be reviewed and is intentional*

*All of the above are applicable regardless of who is entering the profile, and for both registration and grandfathered players*

Country Listing: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Country+Listing

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a registration profile my Org has entered is moved to Correction Needed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigate to the club Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN a Registration profile that was originally entered by a Club user is moved to a Correction Needed status
custom_expected:
THEN The system will send the notification to the registering Org. See Clipboard #1. 
AND This does NOT happen for BOC users. 

Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Clipboard+-+International+Profile

*Because so many users have international profile edit permissions, I think we will need to use the Club Registration Admin Roles to drive this notification*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Select a player for L2 Registration
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_l2_registration_listing_-_boc
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=select_popup
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+Selection
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the L2 Possibility widget and is viewing it for current signing period
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Select" button for any player on the L2 Possibility widget that has a completed L1 Registration profile that has a current Registration Status of "Verified"
AND the "Select" button should not be available for prior years
AND clicking "Select" should open a pop up, per the provided wireframe 
AND "BOC (All)" should be checked by default
AND when BOC is checked, the Select2 should be blanked out and disabled
AND when BOC is unchecked, the Select2 should be available and it should be a multi-select2 that allows the user to pick one or more of the 30 Clubs
AND when either "BOC" is checked OR at least one Org has been added, the "Confirm" button should enable
AND clicking the "Cancel" button should close the pop up and no changes should be made to the player
AND clicking "Confirm" should select the player for L2 Registration by the entered Organization(s)
AND the pop up should close, and the selection should display in the L2 Possibilities widget
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read "Selected" for all users if the player was selected by BOC
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read "Selected" ONLY for the BOC and the Selecting Org if the player was not selected by the BOC. It should continue to read "No" for all other Orgs
AND the player should be available in the BOC's Level 2 Registered widget
AND the player should be available in all Club's Level 2 Registered widget if the player was selected by the BOC
AND the player should be available only in the BOC and the selecting Org's widget if the player was selected by an Org other than the BOC
AND the "Select" button should still be available for the Player in the L2 Possibilities widget. Clicking on this again should open the same popup with whatever was selected the first time displayed. The user should have the opportunity to change or add Orgs using the pop up

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when a registration profile my Org has entered is moved to Verified
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigate to the club Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN a Registration profile that was originally entered by a Club user is moved to the Verified Registration status for the first time
custom_expected:
THEN The System will send the notification to registering Org. See Clipboard #2.
AND This does NOT happen for BOC users. 

*Because so many users have international profile edit permissions, I think we will need to use the Club Registration Admin Roles to drive this notification*
Clipboard: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Clipboard+-+International+Profile

title: As a BOC user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile (Required Fields)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Edit Permissions for existing Registration Profile
AND user is viewing a Registration Profile in Edit mode
AND user is editing an existing Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Save" button
custom_expected:
THEN The system will run a required field and formatting check on the profile.
AND The required field check should only require that any one of the Profile's Origins contain all of the required fields - and this will not necessarily be the one being edited at that time. 

Example Scenario: 
 - ARI registers a player, completing the entire profile.
 - BOC edits the player profile, choosing to edit the BOC contact information/attached files
 - BOC clicks 'save'
 - BOC should NOT be stopped from saving because they left any of the required fields in Contact Info or Attached files blank, since those are all contained in the ARI version. As long as the profile has ONE completed contact info and ONE completed attached files section, the required field check is satisfied.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a Club  user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile (Required Fields)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with Edit Permissions for existing Registration Profile
AND user is viewing a Registration Profile in Edit mode
AND user is editing an existing Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN use click "Save" button
custom_expected:
THEN The system will run a required field and formatting check on the profile.
AND The required field check will ONLY be run on the Club's version of the Contact Info and Attached Files section if they are the Registering Org.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to add a Registration Profile to my Club registration List via the Registration Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user is logged in with permission to see and load a Registration profile that has not yet added to their club Registration List
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration Profile that has not ye been added to their Club Registration List
custom_expected:
THEN The the Profile should display an "Add to Club Reg List" button. 
AND Clicking "Add to Club Reg List" will perform the following actions: 
  -  The Registration Profile should be added to the viewing Org's Club Registration List for the relevant Signing Period, based on the player's Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The system should reload the existing Registration profile in edit mode. 
  - The Club user should have the ability to add their own Contact Information and Attached Files to the Registration Profile. They should not be able to view the Contact Info or Attached Files of other Clubs - nor should they be able to edit any other information on the profile. There should be an edit/save button available and those should work as though the Club was editing an existing registration profile accessed via any other means. 
  - Regardless of what actions they take while on the Registration Profile itself - the player should appear on the Club's Registration List from that point forward, and therefore be visible to the Org in searches and widgets.
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

title: As a BOC User I want to see a list of L2 Possibilities
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logs in with permissions to view Possible L2 List Widget
custom_steps: WHEN users click "L2 Reg" tab under International on the dashboard
custom_expected:
THAN The Possible L2 List widget is the first widget for the BOC users on that tab. 
AND The Possible L2 List widget matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The population will be covered in other stories, but basically any player that was marked as an L2 Possibility (checkbox checked on their profile) during the current Registration Period. 
AND The default Eligible to Sign date range is the upcoming Signing Period (ex: right now that would be 2017-2018).
AND Browser tab text = "L2 Reg"

*Note that there are 3 scouting related columns here. OFP, Group and Report will be populated as part of followup stories*

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_l2_registration_listing_-_boc

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Possible+L2+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to add a Registration Profile to my Club registration List via the Create New
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with permission to Create Registration Profile and Add Registration Profile to their club
AND user is creating a new Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Register" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN The System will run a duplicate check per prior stories. 
AND If a match is found that the Club has permission to see per #155273643 (no such restrictions exist for BOC users) and it is a registration profile that has not yet been added to the Club's Registration List, per #155273652, then selecting the existing Registration profile and clicking "Add to Club Reg List" will perform the following actions: 
  -  The Registration Profile should be added to the viewing Org's Club Registration List for the relevant Signing Period, based on the player's Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The system should navigate the user to the existing Registration profile in edit mode. 
  - The Club user should have the ability to add their own Contact Information and Attached Files to the Registration Profile. They should not be able to view the Contact Info or Attached Files of other Clubs - nor should they be able to edit any other information on the profile.
  - Regardless of what actions they take while on the Registration Profile itself - the player should appear on the Club's Registration List from that point forward, and therefore be visible to the Org in searches and widgets.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches

title: As a Club user I want to be able to check the registration status of a player after the Registration Period has ended
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club user logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND Registration Period has ended
custom_steps: WHEN user try to Register a profile
custom_expected:
THEN There is a system date for each year that is the "registration cut off date".  It is composed of a date and time component.  (Registration Period end date/time on the system dates screen)
AND Prior to the specified date and time, both BOC users and Club users can create Registration profiles for the upcoming Signing Period. 
AND After the specified date and time, Club users should no longer see a "Register" button on the Create New when they have entered the DOB for a player subject to register. The button should now read "Check Registration"
AND The entry of grandfathered players is unaffected. 
AND Entering player information in the Create New and clicking "Check Registration" should run a standard matching check for the player based on the matching rules (all covered in prior stories). 
AND If no match is found, display Message #16.
OR If a match is found, display Message #4. 
AND Club users should still be able to add players to their Club Registration List outside of the Registration period, but if a match is found to an Unregistered profile they do not see a "Register MLSB" button, nor should they see a "Register" button to continue with the registration process with their entered information.


Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to Register an Unregistered Profile from Create New
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is viewing the create new widget
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Register MLSB Entered" on the matching modal
custom_expected:
THEN The system will Load the MLSB Unregistered profile in edit mode. The profile will look like a normal registration profile, just will also have the Scouting Info section visible and editable.
AND The Club user will be able to edit all of the profile's fields. 
AND The Club user will have a "Save" and "Cancel" button just like they do when normally creating a Registration Profile.
AND Clicking "Save" will run the same required field and formatting checks that would be run if they were otherwise entering a Registration Profile. 
AND Once the required field and formatting checks have passed, the profile's Registration Status will update to "Pending BOC Review". 
AND The Scouting Info will continue to display. 
AND If the user clicks "Cancel" or otherwise navigates away from the profile prior to completing the registration process, the profile's Registration Status is not updated, and no changes to the profile are stored.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to Register an Unregistered Profile from Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions to Register Unregistered Profile
AND user is viewing Unregistered profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Register MLSB Entered" button on the profile
custom_expected:
THEN The system will Load the MLSB Unregistered profile in edit mode. The profile will look like a normal registration profile, just will also have the Scouting Info section visible and editable.
AND The Club user will be able to edit all of the profile's fields. 
AND The Club user will have a "Save" and "Cancel" button just like they do when normally creating a Registration Profile.
AND Clicking "Save" will run the same required field and formatting checks that would be run if they were otherwise entering a Registration Profile. 
AND Once the required field and formatting checks have passed, the profile's Registration Status will update to "Pending BOC Review". 
AND The Scouting Info will continue to display. 
AND If the user clicks "Cancel" or otherwise navigates away from the profile prior to completing the registration process, the profile's Registration Status is not updated, and no changes to the profile are stored.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Adding+a+Player+to+the+Club+Registration+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a BOC user I want to see a list of L2 Registered Players
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logged in with permissions to view L2 Registration List widget
custom_steps: WHEN user click "L2" tab under International
custom_expected:
THEN The L2 Registration List widget is the second widget for the BOC users on the L2 tab. 
AND The L2 Registration List widget matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The population is any player that has been selected for Level 2 Registration for the selected Signing Period. 
AND The default Eligible to Sign date range is the upcoming Signing Period (ex: right now that would be 2017-2018).

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=boc_l2_registration_list

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/L2+Registration+List+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to add a player to the L2 Possible list from their profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Admin permissions
AND user is viewing registered player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click "edit" button on the profile
custom_expected:
THEN There is an L2 Possibility checkbox available to only the BOC on profiles of players that are subject to registration.
AND Checking this checkbox and saving the profile will mark the player as an L2 Possibility for the current Signing Period. 
AND The player should now appear in the L2 Possibilities widget. 

*Note that players that were eligible to sign in prior years can be elevated in the current signing period, so which Signing Period they are listed as a possibility for should not be driven by their Elig to Sign date, but when they were selected*

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+Possibility+Rules

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to remove a player from the L2 Possibility widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the L2 Possibility widget
custom_expected:
THEN users will see the L2 Possibility widget with a trash can icon on the L2 Possibilities widget for any player that has NOT been selected. 
AND Clicking the trash can will remove the associated player from the L2 Possibilities widget.
AND The removal will also uncheck the L2 Possibility checkbox from the players profile. 
AND BOC users do not see this trash can icon when viewing prior Signing Periods' lists.

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_l2_registration_listing_-_boc

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to add a player to the L2 Possible list from the Reg Admin widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the Reg Admin widget
custom_expected:
THEN There is a checkbox available for each player on the Reg Admin widget.
AND Users with L2 Permissions can see a "L2 Possibility" button on the Reg Admin widget.
AND Checking off at least one player will enable the L2 Possibility button. 
AND Clicking the button will mark any of the selected players as L2 Possibilities for the current Signing Period. 
AND The players should now appear as L2 Possibilities in the L2 Possibilities widget, as well as have the L2 Possibility checkbox checked on their profile.

title: As a Club user I want a player's registration status updated to Resubmitted to BOC when I edit and save changes to a Correction Needed profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Club user logs in with International Registration permission
AND Club edits an International Registration profile that has any of the three Correction Needed statuses as its current Registration Status
custom_steps: WHEN Club user saves the profile
custom_expected:
THEN the profile should update the player's Registration Status to "Resubmitted to BOC". 
AND The system doesn't need to check if any edits were actually made. 
AND The 3 Review fields should remain unchanged. 
AND  If the BOC subsequently edits/saves with the currently relevant review set to "Correction Needed", then the registration status will be re-set to that Correction Needed status at that time.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to enter Registration Profiles after the Registration Period has ended
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logs in with International Registration permission
AND user sets a date range for "registration cut off date" on the system dates screen
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to Register International Amateur player
custom_expected:
THEN Prior to the specified date and time, both BOC users and Club users can create Registration profiles for the upcoming Signing Period. 
BUT After the specified date and time, BOC users should continue to see a "Register" button on the Create New when they have entered the DOB for a player subject to registration.
AND Between the registration close date and July 2nd, BOC entered players will continue to be for the upcoming signing period.
AND Starting on July 2nd, the profiles will be created for the following year's signing period. 

Example: 
- If the Registration Close date is 6/15/2018, players created by the BOC between 6/15/18 and 7/1/18 will be eligible to sign in the 2018-2019 Signing Period. (Assuming they also will meet the age requirement)
- Starting on 7/2/18, players created by the BOC will be eligible to sign in the 2019-2020 Signing Period (assuming they also meet the age requirement)

title: As a BOC User I only want to be able to set the First Review to "Verified" during certain times of the year
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logs in with International Registration permission
AND user sets a date range for "First Review Period" on the system dates screen
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit the "First Review" on the registration profile
custom_expected:
THEN If current date falls during the entered time frame, then they are able to select "Verified" as the First Review. 
BUT if the user is attempting to edit the "First Review" outside this time frame, then selecting "Verified" will immediately trigger an error message for them. (do NOT wait for save). See Messages #18
AND Closing the modal should return the user to the profile in edit mode, with any other edits they have made maintained. The first review will NOT be set to "Verified".

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Club user I want to be able to see a list of L2 Registered Players
custom_preconds: GIVEN the club user logs with L2 registered player permission
custom_steps: WHEN user is in L2 tab
custom_expected:
THEN the L2 Registration List widget should be the first widget for Club users on the L2 tab. 
AND the L2 Registration List widget matches the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND the population is any player that has been selected by the BOC or the viewing Org for Level 2 Registration for the selected Signing Period. 
AND he default Eligible to Sign date range is the upcoming Signing Period (ex: right now that would be 2017-2018).

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=club_l2_registration_list

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/L2+Registration+List+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I only want to see matching warnings on "Save" of a profile if I have updated a matching related field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
AND user is editing registered player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Save" on an International Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will check to see if any of the matching related fields have been updated on the profile (First, Last, DOB, Twin Count, National ID, Birth City). This is done on initial save as well as subsequent saves.
AND If yes, then the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found, the user gets a warning. See Messages #5.
OR If none of the matching related fields has been updated since the profile was loaded, the system does not perform a match check.


Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

title: As a user I want the system to store "Home Country" separately from the address fields
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user logs in with Registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN Home country is stored at the profile level by the user
custom_expected:
THEN everyone should see the same value for Home Country, regardless of if there are multiple origins entered or one Org does not enter their own set of contact information for the player. 
AND This field is used in Advanced Search, reports, etc, and everyone should see the same value.
AND The field should be set at the time of profile creation to be equal to whatever was input on the Create New - or subsequently entered for the Player's primary address. 
AND The field should be updated if the Primary Address's country is updated if there is only one Origin. If there is more than one Origin, use the first registration information's Primary Address info. 
AND A side effect of this being stored separately before was that players were appearing more than once in Advanced Search if they had multiple origins. The move of this datapoint out of the Contact Info section should alleviate that problem and each player should now only appear once in an Advanced Search result set, regardless of how many origins they have.

title: As an LRD user I want to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_preconds: GIVEN LRD user is on the Email Utility to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_steps: WHEN Club user requests L2 Drug Test Results for a player
custom_expected:
THEN At the end of each day, the system should check to see if any new L2 Drug Test Results requests were entered that day.
AND If no, then no email is generated.
OR If yes, then an email should be generated to those users that are in the Utility under "L2 Drug Test Results" as meant to receive the email.
AND The email should have the subject "mm/dd/yyyy L2 Drug Test Results Requests"
AND The email body should contain a "NEW REQUESTS:" header followed by a bulleted list of all of the requests entered into the system for the day, regardless of current status. The list should be formatted as Requesting Org - First AND Middle Last Extended Last. Ex: ARI - John David Jones Smith
AND Sort of the bulleted list should be on ORG and then on Player name.

title: As a user I want to be able to search for International Trainers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has the new International LDAP
AND the ability to view or edit trainer/agent profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Advance search
custom_expected:
THEN "International Trainer2" should be an option
AND this advanced search should have the filters available per the requirements document
AND the available columns should match the requirements document.
AND Export to excel and pdf should work for the results set.

Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89350397

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Payroll Forecast Report from the Payroll Forecast Utility into excel
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Report listing widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Payroll Forecast" report should e listed
AND A "Run to Excel" option is added to the Payroll Forecast Report prompt when running the report via the Reporting widget.
AND A "Print to Excel" option is visible on the Payroll Forecast Utility screen. 
AND Selecting either of these options will generate an .xls of the Payroll Forecast Utility. 
AND The .xls should match the content of the current report, except "Player ID" should be the first column for the player pages, and "Org" should also be a column. 
AND Ideally the first page would display as its own sheet, with the player pages residing on another.

title: As a user I want to see an error if I attempt to create a UEC for a current player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for creating UEC
AND user attempting to creating a UEC for a player that has any MJ or MN Roster status other than Voluntarily Retired, Free Agent or Released
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Employee Contract" under Contract
custom_expected:
THEN system will throw an error Messages #28. 
AND This rule should also be checked on any state change in which the On Submit rules are called.


Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+UEC+-+On+Create+Rules
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/3.+UEC+-+On+Submit+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Messages
